title: Georgia Senate Runoff Election Results (Published 2021)
summary: In the 2021 Georgia Senate runoff elections, both Democratic candidates, Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock, defeated their Republican opponents, securing control of the Senate for the Democrats. Jon Ossoff, a Democrat, won against the Republican incumbent David Perdue with 50.6% of the votes, while Raphael Warnock, also a Democrat, defeated the Republican incumbent Kelly Loeffler with 51.0% of the votes. The Democratic victories were attributed to a higher turnout, particularly among Black voters, compared to usual runoff elections. The results indicated strong Democratic support in counties such as Fulton, Gwinnett, and DeKalb. These elections concluded before the official announcement that confirmed Joe Biden's presidential victory, amidst tumultuous events at the U.S. Capitol.
snippet: David Perdue, a Republican whose Senate term ended on Sunday, has faced a competitive challenge from Jon Ossoff, a documentary film executive. In November, Mr. Perdue fell just short of the ...

title: Facts vs Myths: Was the 2020 Election Stolen? | AllSides
summary: The claim that the 2020 presidential election was 'stolen' from Donald Trump is rooted in various factors, including accusations of voter fraud, media bias, and efforts by the 'deep state.' Proponents argue that Democrats orchestrated voter fraud, manipulated election rules, and that biased media unfairly influenced public opinion against Trump. However, investigations and lawsuits failed to provide evidence of widespread voter fraud that could have changed the outcome. Critics also highlight that legal and factual challenges to the election results have been unsuccessful. In contrast, some on the right argue that changes to election rules, particularly regarding mail-in voting, made fraud easier, while others point to media and social media bias. Trump's efforts to challenge the election results, including claims of fraud and conspiracies, have been widely criticized for lacking evidence but viewed by some as a response to the left's previous attempts to delegitimize his 2016 victory. The left, in turn, dismisses the claims of a stolen election, emphasizing the lack of substantial fraud and accusing those who promote such theories of undermining democracy. Despite the failure of legal challenges and the absence of evidence proving fraud on a scale large enough to impact the election, some people still view the outcome as manipulated, based on perceived unfair practices or media interference. Therefore, while the 'stolen' election claim remains largely unsupported by facts, it persists as a subjective judgment rather than a substantiated fact.
snippet: The claim that the 2020 presidential election was stolen from Donald Trump has underscored most political discourse in the U.S. for over a year. There is no evidence that voter fraud led to Trumps defeat. But some on the right and elsewhere hold a broader definition of stolen in this case. What Left-Rated Media Does

title: Fact check: New David Perdue TV ad tells two election lies at once - CNN
summary: David Perdue, a Republican former senator from Georgia, has launched a TV ad featuring false claims regarding the 2020 election. In the ad, Perdue accuses incumbent Governor Brian Kemp of allowing radicals to steal the election and vows to prevent future election theft. These claims are false, as Joe Biden legitimately won the 2020 election, including Georgia, and there is no substantial evidence of fraud. Kemp, who formalized Biden's victory in Georgia, was not involved in any election theft. Perdue's campaign, backed by Donald Trump, has hinged on contesting the 2020 election results, despite such claims being debunked. CNN's article highlights the ongoing falsehoods promoted by Perdue in his primary challenge against Kemp.
snippet: Perdue's false election rhetoric has been especially explicit in the last month. Before Trump held a rally in support of Perdue's candidacy in late March, Perdue claimed in a radio interview that...

title: Fact check: Georgia audit hasn't found 30,000 'fake ballots' - USA TODAY
summary: A preliminary audit in Georgia has not found 30,000 'fake ballots' as claimed in a May 27 Facebook post. Three separate audits of Georgia's 2020 election results uncovered no widespread fraud. The Facebook claim stemmed from unverified affidavits alleging up to 30,000 counterfeit ballots, but these affidavits do not prove such ballots were fabricated. The review of absentee ballots in Fulton County has not begun yet, with procedures still under consideration. Claims of election fraud in Georgia have been repeatedly debunked, with no evidence to support the allegations.
snippet: The claim that a preliminary audit in Georgia found 30,000 'fake ballots' is FALSE, based on our research. Three separate audits of Georgia's 2020 election results found no evidence of widespread ...

title: Fact check: New David Perdue TV ad tells two election lies at once ...
summary: Republican former US senator and gubernatorial candidate David Perdue released a TV ad containing false claims about the 2020 election. In the ad, Perdue alleges that the election was stolen and blames current Georgia Governor Brian Kemp for allowing it to happen. Contrary to Perdue's claims, official counts confirm Joe Biden's legitimate win in Georgia by 11,779 votes, with no evidence of widespread voter fraud. Perdue has consistently made false election claims and has received support from former President Trump, who also falsely claims election fraud. Despite trailing in the polls, Perdue continues to emphasize these unfounded allegations in his campaign against Kemp. His candidacy includes lawsuits based on conspiracy theories and an ongoing narrative of falsehoods about the 2020 election.
snippet: Before Trump held a rally in support of Perdues candidacy in late March, Perdue claimed in a radio interview that both the presidential election and his election against Ossoff were stolen ...

title: Georgia Election Results 2021 | Live Senate Runoff Map | Perdue vs Ossoff
summary: Jon Ossoff (Democrat) defeated David Perdue (Republican) in the 2021 Georgia Senate runoff, giving Democrats a narrow 50-50 control of the Senate. Ossoff received 2,269,738 votes (50.6%), while Perdue received 2,214,506 votes (49.4%).

title: David Perdue at Debate: 2020 Election 'Rigged and Stolen' - Mediaite
summary: Former Senator David Perdue, during a Republican primary debate, claimed that the 2020 election was 'rigged and stolen' including both the presidential election and the January 2021 Georgia Senate runoff. PolitiFact had previously debunked these assertions, labeling them as false and highlighting that a judge dismissed a related case involving ballot inspection in Fulton County. Perdue, endorsed by former President Donald Trump, reiterated these claims despite lack of evidence and his campaign's refusal to comment further. Additionally, he faulted the incumbent Georgia Governor Brian Kemp, accusing him of allowing Democrats to manipulate the election. Despite support, Perdue trails Kemp in the polls.

title: Was there fraud during the Georgia Senate Runoff elections? - Echo Check
summary: The text argues there was electoral fraud during the Georgia Senate Runoff elections, similar to alleged fraud in the 2020 presidential election. Claims include manipulation in voter tallies, lack of partisan observers, an improbable increase in voter turnout, nighttime vote counting stoppages, ballot dumps, and vote spikes. The text asserts these are signs of Democratic Party fraud, similar to tactics alleged in the presidential race. The commentary concludes the Democrats used these methods to secure victories in Georgia, suggesting Republicans cannot win without addressing these alleged irregularities.
snippet: Considering the above Its patently obvious to any objective observer that the democrats planned to steal the Georgia senate race just as they stole the presidency.
